newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Zeppelin to invest over 60 mln DM in Hungary plant.
newsitem.headline: Zeppelin to invest over 60 mln DM in Hungary plant.

text.p: Germany's Ferdinand Zeppelin (FZ) group plans to invest more than 60 million marks in its gearbox plant in Hungary over the next two years, the MTI news agency said on Friday.

MTI quoted Ulrich Diller, chairman and chief executive of FZ Hungaria Kft, FZ's subsidiary in Hungary, as saying that the plant -- located in Eger, 120 km east of Budapest -- planned to produce an annual 70,000 gearboxes a year from 1998.
The German group bought the plant in 1995 and transferred the whole production line from its Brandenburg plant, MTI said.
FZ Hungaria expects a turnover of 10 million marks this year and plans to reach an annual turnover of 55 million marks by 1998.
